post.title: Old Car Radio
post.summary: I’m only now starting to really utilize the feature Spotify initially used as it’s major marketing point. PLAYLISTS! I remember all the annoying ads they’d send me about making playlists, but they actually are kind of useful. I have recently been contemplating the fact that, depending on which thoughts and emotions are salient, people can be vastly different people. This might sound like I’m making people out to be like nebulous, shifting blobs of personality, but I actually think it’s more complex than that. I believe that when we experience a new environment, our psychologies form a specific response that puts us in the best situation possible in that environment while still utilizing your key psychological underpinnings. In this way, we become different versions of ourselves, but all of these versions are still classified under the same identity, that of the individual. The individual might be violent and belligerent in some environments, condescending in others, and caring and nurturing in others still. While this makes it difficult to establish an inherent value on a person, it does not make them identity-less, in my theory at least. I have recently been realizing how much this can be reflected in the music we choose to listen to, and when we choose to listen to certain songs. I recently hooked up with a friend of mine back home. Weirdly she’s a friend of Natalie (my ex/best friend) and we hadn’t really talked since two winters ago, when she was suffering from crippling anxiety and depression, at times refusing to take her meds, at other times cutting herself. I had felt a very nurturing urge to protect and care for her that winter, and we hung out a lot, and did actually make out briefly when we first started hanging out, but then just became flirty friends (as we were both dating other people at the time). But this winter we were both single, though both of us are still very much friends with our respective ex’s. She stayed over at my place and we had a good time, though we didn’t have sex, due to the source of her anxiety. The whole time we were hanging out, I pretty much wanted to play the trendiest music I’d found, especially since we hadn’t seen each other in so long, and she had introduced me to many great artists the last winter we’d hung out. But some of the music we really bonded over that first winter was the crappy cheesy music that would play on the radio and that we liked in middle school. We both had a live-hate relationship with these songs, and mostly it was fun to laugh over how much we liked them when we were younger, something we did again this winter using Spotify. In the context of bonding with overlapping experiences, this music was fun to listen to, and enjoyable. I didn’t ever necessarily like the music my mom would play in the car whenever we were driving—which, being so far from town for most of my life, was a lot—but being just about the only music I was exposed to other than Disney tunes, I didn’t have much choice but to at least enjoy it while it was on. I would often even relate many of the lyrics to my life, so who knows what associations I was forming with those words and melodies. I have long sense condemned just about all of the music that used to play on those poppy, mainstream, family-friendly radio stations, the very fluff that suffocates creativity in music. But then something happened. My mom got rid of XM recently, and so a lot of this fluff was unavoidable. Luckily, I discovered that the radio was playing some pretty trendy stuff, along with, of course, the more repetitive, derivative phoniness that record companies churn out. But at a few points over break, while driving Natalie around, an oldie that I recognized from long ago car rides would come on, and I’d sing with it, kind of at her, for I knew she’d never heard these songs as a kid. No, her mom was true hippy, and had listened to and still listens to the likes of Kate Bush, Joni Mitchel, Tori Amos and the like, a platinum wall of alternative CDs blockading the radio. So I sang along with these songs almost tauntingly, but I began to realize that many of these songs not only represented a nostalgic, cherished time of my life, but they were actually rather strong musically and many had real depth and uniqueness. Think “Losing My Religion” by R.E.M., “Fast Car: by Tracey Chapman, “Breakfast at Tiffany’s” by Deep Blue Something, “Landslide” by Fleetwood Mac, “The Logical Song” by Supertramp and “She’s so High” by Tal Bachman. These might have seemed fluffy, over-relatable and poppy, but they were really just indicative of the times they were written in. Their melodic structure feels dated now, but I can imagine people my age hearing it for the first time when it first came out would have found it interesting and iconic. And many of these did turn out to be iconic in nature, which I think may sometimes be too quickly confused with cliche and phony. Old Car Radio I bring this up because it’s a great part of that strange phenomenon of music fitting certain moods and states of mind. I’ve made a playlist for those songs, and Working Out/Washing the Dishes, one that I think would be great Trailer Music, and one called THC, which started out as a playlist to inspire the story I was working on “The Hero Chronicles”, but quickly became a music to smoke weed to for obvious reasons, and is now just pretty much all of my favorite music. It was really my first foray into playlists, but it lacked the kind of specificity of other states of minds, as it eventually just became another tier of quality in the eclectic mix I listen to. With these new playlists, I’m refining the different versions of myself, or at least distilling them to musical form. I think it’s very important to remember all the kinds of people you can be, and all the kinds of people you have been. Identifying what we share is the best way to interact with people. There’s no better social tool than the words “I know exactly what you mean.” And the more things you can say that truthfully to people about, the more you will connect, and the stronger those connections will be. It is a simple fact that as people age, they will have more and more overlapping experiences, and this is likely what is often referred to as “wisdom.” It’s a variety of experiences, and in turn, a variety of roles and performances, demanding different social skills, behaviors, and perhaps even philosophies. There is a very powerful drawing effect, a gravity, surrounding the people who have experienced the most, especially if they use those experiences to relate to people in positive ways, adding relevant anecdotes and exhibiting similar reactions to shared circumstances. I believe my recent job interviews went so well in part because of this. Not because I have a lot of experience, but because I made an effort to focus on the experiences I shared with people, and constantly trying to put myself in the other person’s shoes, which is of course made easier with more experience. This also helps immensely in writing characters, since the ability to put yourself in others’ shoes is a requisite for writing good characters. One of the biggest uses of my playlists before my recent expansion was to get in the mood of movies I’m writing, with many songs representing specific characters’ arcs and attitudes. It’ll be interesting to see what kind of fruits the Old Car Radio playlists yields.

post.title: Passenger – Let Her Go
post.summary: Listen to Passenger - Let Her Go (4,17 min) on spotify. Let Her Go can be found on the album Let Her Go which were released 2012, track nr: 1About PassengerThere are at least six artists and bands who have performed with the name "Passenger". The following order is loosely based on the last.fm statistics. 1. A Swedish alternative metal band including members of In Flames. 2. A Brighton (UK) based alternative folk band. 3. A San José, Costa Rica hardcore/screamo band. 4. A Mesa, Arizona based acoustic rock band. 5. A rap artist from Texas. 6. An old alias of DJ Tiësto. 7. A Chicago-based instrumental rock band. 8. A psytrance project of MFG's Guy Zukrel. ------------------------------ Passenger was formed in 1995 by Sten and Engelin. Both members wanted to do something that was not thrash metal or melodic death metal unlike the bands they played in. At its early stages the band was originally called "Cliff". Under the name Cliff they recorded two demos in Studio Fredman that were never released. After a break in the band and after Engelin was hired as a session guitarist for In Flames' Whoracle tour, Anders Fridén, the vocalist of In Flames showed interest in Passenger and joined the band. In the year 2000 the band came back from its break and went on to record a demo. In 2001 the band recorded another demo in which early versions of the songs "Used", "In My Head", "Circus" and "Drowning City" were recorded. After a third demo the band finally recorded and released their debut album entitled Passenger. A video for "In Reverse" was also released. Sten noted in February 2004 on their official website that they were in the process of recording their second album. However, since then, Fridén, lead vocalist of both Passenger and In Flames has been noted saying that he has very little time for the project, due to other commitments, and the group is currently on hold. In an interview with Fridén he stated that as soon as he gets a break from In Flames, he wants to get all the group together to record a second album for early 2010. This did however not happen as Anders continued touring with In Flames until October 2010 when they entered their studio to record their next album. ------------------------------ The brainchild of 26-year-old Brighton born singer/songwriter Mike Rosenberg, Passenger is redefining the troubadour for the 21st century. Formerly a five-piece band, Passenger has now pared back to basics, quite literally bringing music to the streets on a series of lengthy busking journeys across Australia, America and the United Kingdom. A classic journeyman musician, cut from the same mould as Van Morrison, Neil Young and John Prine, Passenger has the unique ability to move from the humorous to heartbreaking with every song. After a year spent crisscrossing the UK and US with his debut album Wicked Man's Rest, Passenger's markedly stripped down and soulful second album Wide Eyes Blind Love was brought to the public as it was created: on the road. Setting up on street corners across the UK and Australia, Passenger halted passers by in their hundreds; all connecting to the mellifluous tones and powerfully hewn lyrics emanating from this lone figure and his guitar. This is music as Passenger means it to be, unvarnished and honest, just pure talent and powerful tunes that tap straight into the heart of the crowd. Struck by the dynamic freedom of the troubadour life, Passenger developed the grass roots method of Wide Eyes Blind Love into the germ of a new album. Impressively and entirely self funded through busking income, Passenger set about recording a series of collaborations with musical friends met along the way. Flight Of The Crow is the remarkable result of Passenger's intrepid journey, with Australian artists Lior, Josh Pyke, Katie Noonan, Boy & Bear, Kate Miller Heidke, Philadelphia Grand Jury, Brian Campeau and Elana Stone, Matt Corby, Jess Chalker and Dead Letter Chorus all lending their voices to this serendipitous creative venture. Flight Of The Crow was recorded in Sydney's famous BJB studios over February and March of 2010, and co-produced by Berkfinger (AKA Simon Berkleman from Philadelphia Grand Jury). As a second album born of the road, Flight Of The Crow speaks to the compelling quality of Passenger's music and the striking sincerity of his lyrics, both of which are matched by his dedication to this grass roots style of craftsmanship and collaboration. How utterly remarkable that a lone musician can travel the globe, and literally from the street, connect with some of Australia's finest musical talents to produce a self-funded album. This is the stuff of legend, with Passenger clearly evoking the humble, hardworking creativity of the troubadours of old. www.myspace.com/passengerofficial ------------------------------ Passenger or PSNGR is an active hardcore/screamo band formed in San José, Costa Rica born in 2004. Their EP "Get OFF the Rails!" (tentative title) will be out in 20/01/09. Band members: Alejandro Pacheco[/bandmember] (vocals & guitar), Grego Rojas (guitar), Andres Moraga (bass), Jose Vargas (drums). www.myspace.com/passenger ------------------------------ Passenger the acoustic rock band was formed in late 2000. They have a large archive of both original music and cover songs. They released their first pressed album, entitled "Four Letter Word", in September 2004 on indie label Crop Circle Records. ------------------------------ Passenger is an Austin, Texas based MC. Born in Massachusetts, he spent most of his younger days growing up in New York and Houston, Tx eventually moving to Austin, Tx in 1996 attending college to try his hand as a sound engineer. During these years, his musical versatility had him playing bass in an alternative rock band, singing in another side project, DJing house, jungle and hip hop music at various venues in Austin. Eventually he became a full time DJ for the reggae/ska/hiphop/punk band, Indofin, which he was a member for years touring the country. His love for hip hop provoked him to purchase an MPC and has been making beats and rhyming ever since. "The Brick In A Glass House", his debut album, contains production from Nozebleed, Lazerbeak (Doomtree), amongst others as well as his own and has guests from Austin's own Emcee, Justin Cook, Weezel, as well as a few others. Currently, you can find him playing shows around the Austin area and will begin to venturing out to other Texas cities. He is also working on putting together a live band to back him at shows and working on new material. ------------------------------ Passenger is also an old alias of DJ Tiësto. Tiësto only produced 2 tracks under his old Passenger-alias: "Blackspin" and "F.A.H.", both appearing on a record released on Momentum Records in 1996. ------------------------------ Passenger began winter of 2002 when guitarist dustin covert and bassist/vocalist david mata collaborated on the bands first full length "alive" an 8 song full length about a disoriented and dark but intriguing view of love and romance. the album explored dissonant melodies and agonizingly slow chord progressions with the use of mark sampson on drums and sam billen on piano. in 2003 passenger progressed to a four person line up with michael oberlin on drums and james demis on keyboards and sound and began to play various rock venues in chicago, illinois and used silent film to accompany their live performance. numerous line-up changes took effect during the next year and a half, but in 2005 the concrete line-up of Dustin Covert and David D'Antonio on guitars, David Mata on Bass and Samuel Vincent on drums was achieved. In winter of 2005 Passenger recorded "The Owls are Restless", a 2 hour and 40 minute concept record about an ancient war between owls and rabbits and was recorded and engineered by Steve Whitney in a warehouse in Aurora, Illinois. Shortly after the recording drummer Samuel Vincent tragically passed away. Without his talent and with the grief of losing a dear, dear friend the band decided it was impossible to continue performing the material or anything that involved Passenger. These unfortunate events occurred before "The Owls are Restless" was able to achieve any sort of record label attention, and when it finally did it was too late. The remaining musicians have continued creating in their band White Devil, named after the vintage moog synth/organ that Sam would play in collaboration with his drums in Passenger. myspace.com/whitedevilchicago last.fm Pictures of PassengerShow more imagesMore: Passenger Norwegian Long Haul A/S Terms and Conditions for Boeing 787 First ...Music video with PassengerHere you can find videos from Youtube with Passenger - Let Her GoThe official video for new single 'Let Her Go' Directed and Produced by Dave Jansen. Amazing work Dave. www.theloop.com.au Taken from Top 10 album 'All The Little Lights' Available now from www.passengermusic.com. www.itunes.com/passenger itunes.apple.com (Netherlands) itunes.apple.com (UK) passenger.spinshop.com (UK) www.amazon.com/dp/B008B8AOQI/?tag=nettwerk-20 (US) www.amazon.ca/dp/B008B8AOQI/?tag=nettwerk-20 (Canada) www.amazon.de (Germany) "Let Her Go" [Lyrics] Well you only need the light when it's burning low Only miss the sun when it starts to snow Only know you love her when you let her go Only know you've been high when you're feeling low Only hate the road when you're missin' home Only know you love her when you let her go And you let her go Staring at the bottom of your glass Hoping one day you'll make a dream last But dreams come slow and they go so fast You see her when you close your eyes Maybe one day you'll understand why Everything you touch surely dies But you only need the light when it's burning low Only miss the sun when it starts to snow Only know you love her when you let her go Only know you've been high when you're feeling low Only hate the road when you're missin' home Only know you love her when you let her go Staring at the ceiling in the dark Same old empty feeling in your heart 'Cause love comes slow and it goes so fast Well you see her when you fall asleep But never to touch and never to keep 'Cause you loved her too much And you dived too ... post.title: bright eyes
post.summary: After the radio last night I am completely brain dead today. I’ve been intermittently doing homework (attempting homework) and staring off into space… I decided music might help me focus, and the first song that played on the station I put on was this one^, The First Day of My Life by Bright Eyes. I fell in love with it immediately, and have already listened to it a few 1,000 times (haha not really… >.>) Give it a listen, it’s really nice and mellow for my poor mushy brain. If you liked the Juno sound track you’ll love this– it’s super indie, acoustic guitary, sleepy guy singer, the works :] I’ll post about the radio soon!!! It went really well and was super duper fun [SW]

post.title: Dvalen.
post.summary:
yoooo. Akkurat nå sitter jeg og venter på at Daniel skal komme bortover. Med pizza. Jeg er så sulten at den pizzaen begynner å bli litt viktig... Bortsett fra å vente gjør jeg absolutt ingenting. Jeg har gått inn i en liten fase hvor jeg noterer ned alt jeg skal gjøre (som er mer enn jeg har skjønt selv, og selvfølgelig har jeg knapt med tid til å gjøre alt og), og så er det akkurat som om jeg tror jeg er ferdig med det. Det er jo tross alt notert, står i agendaen og alt sammen. Da blir det sikkert gjort. Bare ikke akkurat nå. Eller idag. Tar det imorgen. Ellers har jeg gjort masse produktive ting jeg egentlig ikke trenger å gjøre! Siden fredag har jeg lest ei og ei halv bok faktisk. Og jeg har ordnet meg netflix, og for første gang på flere år har jeg sett en hel film alene! Jeg ser aldri film alene... Men i går gjorde jeg altså det. Og det var egentlig helt fint å se en film alene. Selv om jeg alltid har tenkt at hvis jeg først har tid til å være alene, så burde jeg bruke den tiden til å gjøre noe fornuftig. Gamer het den. Den var dødskul. Jeg liker Gerard Butler, jeg liker actionfilmer og jeg liker sånn fiktiv fremtidsgalskap og overbruk av syk teknologi. Tror jeg skal tvinge Daniel til å se den en dag. Også har jeg sett taken 2, og den likte jeg også. Den så jeg dog ikke alene, men sammen med Daniel, moren og Petter. Den var ikke så bra som førstefilmen, men det var allikevel absolutt verdt å se. Også har jeg fikset meg spotify premium! Man får jo en gratis prøvemåned, men jeg har ikke giddet siden både Daniel, mamma og Kaja alltid har hatt premium. Nå har ikke Daniel premium lengre, og mamma og Kaja bruker spotifyen sin så ofte at det ikke er vits å dele. Jeg liker å ha en egen spotify. For det første fant jeg masse sanger jeg har lagret opp igjennom årene, og for det andre er det så deilig å kunne sortere spillelister som jeg selv vil. Også føler jeg at musikklistene presenterer hvem jeg er. Og det liker jeg. Det er litt sånn som med bokhylla mi. Jeg føler at jeg MÅ ha alle bøkene jeg liker i bokhylla fordi bokhylla også representerer hvem jeg er. Det er kanskje litt rart, men det er en ting jeg har. Poenget mitt er egentlig at spotify er blitt ett slags trofè-prosjekt for min del. Jeg MÅ ha alle sangene jeg liker inn dit. Og dermed har jeg ett prosjekt som teknisk sett er evigvarende. Så er det alle disse oppgavene jeg egentlig ikke vil tenke på. Som jeg skal tenke på i morgen. Jeg kunne ha skrevet dere side opp og ned med alt jeg egentlig burde gjøre, men jeg tror jeg eventuelt tar det etterhvert som jeg faktisk gjør det. Og det summerer vel egentlig opp alt det som har skjedd i går og idag. Bortsett fra at jeg måtte dusje i kaldt vann idag. Det var nesten litt tøft. Følte meg litt harcore der jeg sto og innså at "shit, man må faktisk lide for skjønnheten". Også led jeg for skjønnheten. Og hygienen. Og det var litt tøft. Jeg innser at det er ganske lite/merkelige ting som skal til for å gjøre meg glad og tenkende. Det er rart. Jeg tror det kommer av den boka jeg leste. Den heter Xeroxdager og er skrevet av Caroline Palonen. Hun er faktisk fra Harstad, og jobber på Norli! Men jeg har aldri møtt henne, for hun permiterte seg før jeg begynte. Men det er litt tøft allikevel. Jeg håper hun kommer tilbake så jeg får møtt henne og fortalt henne at jeg likte boka hennes, selv om jeg likte den på en veldig spesiell måte jeg ikke helt kan forklare. Tror jeg skal lage ett eget innlegg om den. Foreløpig kan dere komme innom på jobb og spørre om den. Vi selger den i pocket for knapt over en hundrelapp, og den er absolutt verd å lese. Det er virkelig en av de bedre bøkene jeg har lest. Så da har jeg vel til syvende og sist oppsummert idag og igår. Også har jeg glemt å fortelle dere at jeg bodde hos Daniel i hele forrige uke! Det var faktisk så fint. Ett helt hus, egne middager, alt sammen. Vi har spilt COD på hver vår tv, på hver vår ps3 hver dag, spilt monopol, laget pizza og pizza og pizza (og burger) til middag, hatt tacokveld sammen med venner og spilt minecraft og sett film. Verken jeg eller Daniel har vært i særlig form i det siste, så det var fint å kunne slappe litt av. Men nå begynner jeg å bli lei av å være dårlig, så jeg tror jeg skal kjøpe noe vitamintilskudd og håpe på det beste. Ellers går dagene på å jobbe, gå på skole, gjøre skolearbeid, russestyrearbeid og, shopping og nettshopping. Jeg har kjøpt valentinsgave til Daniel som jeg håper han liker, også har jeg kjøpt masse greier til meg selv som jeg vet jeg liker. Det er fint.
Også leste jeg på kravene for å gå Journalistikk på høgskolen. Og ett av de kravene er faktisk at man må ha ett eget kvalitets-kamera, fordi når vi skal gjøre høgskoleoppgaver og skrive saker og slikt har jeg ansvar for å ta bilder selv. Så jeg tror jeg skal dra og kjøpe meg ett speilreflekskamera i neste uke. Og kanskje få ett hurtigkurs hos Lisabeth.... Etter tre år på medier og kommunkasjon er jeg fremdeles ikke helt inne på det her med blender og lukkertid og hvitbalanse og alt... Ironiskt. Og sånn ser jeg ut idag. Ingen særlige forandringer på den fronten.

post.title: Olden days..
post.summary:
Nå sitter jeg og "nynner" på noen sanger som jeg sang på kor når jeg var liten. På onsdag har jeg gått i kor i 10 år! Jeg kjenner jeg vil tilbake til 3.klasse nesten når jeg hører disse sangene! Jeg går i et kristen-kor og er Kristen selv. Det er egentlig utrolig gøy å gå i kor! Opp igjennom årene har jeg gått i tre kor; Solstrålen, sing singeling og sing out (Ja, kleine navn)! Men tilbake til de sangene. Jeg kan jo egentlig skrive hva de heter? : Puslespill - Jentegruppa Seven Helt Unik - Jentegruppa Seven ♥ Levende Reklame - Jentegruppa Seven ♥ Join Us - Jentegruppa Seven ♥ Stormen - Jentegruppa Seven ♥ Shout - Oslo Soul Children ♥ I Have A Song - Oslo Soul Children ♥ Sing Hallelujah - Oslo Soul Children ♥ Jesus Du Er God - Oslo Soul Chidren ♥ Livsglede - Oslo Soul Children ♥ Det Er Gøy, Gøy, Gøy - Oslo Soul Children ♥ Joh 3,16 - Oslo Soul Children ♥ Min Beste kompis - Oslo Soul Children ♥ Your Friend - Team Sulebakk ♥ Der Er Du - Team Sulebakk ♥ Stjernekikkert - Astrid & Bjarte Leithaug ♥ Estoy Feliz - Astrid & Bjarte Leithaug ♥ Vi Er Tusen - Astrid & Bjarte Leithaug ♥ Tenn Et Lite Lys - Astrid & Bjarte Leithaug ♥ Hele Jorda Rundt - Astrid & Bjarte Leithaug ♥

post.title: Simply Saving Saturday
post.summary: It's often hard to see the tangible savings from the simple things I do every day to save money and I sometimes find myself discouraged with my efforts. Writing down all those little things I do in order to live more frugally has helped me to see that all those little things actually can make a big difference! Here's how I was able to simply save this week: --Made chicken stock. --Made apple oatmeal muffins with apples that were getting too soft. --Received a free cat food sample. --Listened to music for free on Spotify. --Bought bread at the bread store during their 5 for $5 sale. --Cut buttons off an old shirt of hubby's before throwing it away. --Downloaded a free ebook to my Kindle for PC. How were you able to simply save this week?

post.title: God Natt
post.summary:
Superherlig å legge seg i badekaret for å vaske og kuret håret itillegg til å nyte en ansiktsmaske. Det gjorde virkelig godt etter en uke i sofaen innpakket i ullklær og pysj. Skulle egentlig vært i dobbel bursdagsfest i kveld, men ettersom jeg har vært syk drar jeg ikke avgårde uten å føle meg bra for, kun for å smitte alle andre. Var vell en fin erstatning med spotify, drikke og stearinlys.
Dagen har kun gått til PC, snakket med familien, spist boller, tatt et bad og sett TV. Likevell har den vært mer innholdsrik enn alle de andre dagene tilsammen denne uken. Ser virkelig frem til å bli frisk, komme meg opp om morgenen og få noe ut av dagen! Slik det skal være Helene, you Go Girl! God Natt! Helene

post.title: Natt- inlägg
post.summary: Har haft bästa kvällen på länge! Har chattat med mina allra bästa vänner i flera timmar och har fått ur mig massor! Tänker på hur mycket musik egentligen betyder, när man väl förstår vad de sjunger om. Hjälper verkligen i alla lägen! Älskar spotify föralltid! Ha en bra (!) natt 💗
post.blogName: MY STORY, MY LIFE & MY CHOICES

post.title: La sublime pasión de mis sentidos.
post.summary: Eres la sublime poesía de mis sentidos.Eres de mi espíritu alimento.Eres quien da cuerda a mi corazón y a mis latidos.Eres quien aleja de mí cualquier tormento. Besos que curan y alivian las yagasde mi boca y de mi alma.Besos que cubren y atenúan los lamentosde mi origen y de mis adentros.Besos que fluyen y conectan las miradasde párpados cerrados y manos enlazadas. Miedo, que me alejas,déjame estar en paz conmigo.Miedo, que me aterras,alza tu estoque ahora,que en duelo caerás batido. Monstruos, que carcomen mis entrañas,salid por mi boca entre mis cantos.Monstruos, que perseguís en sueños mis talones,huiréis ahora vosotros,llenos de luz mis interiores. Baste tu presencia entre tinieblas.Baste tu sonrisa y baste tu esencia, para derrocar la muerte que traen los días,las noches, los otoños,toda una vida. Paulus M. Ray Charles - Hit The Road Jack Groveshark || Spotify Ray Charles - Hallelujah I Love Her So Groveshark || Spotify

post.title: ~ we're beautiful like diamonds in the sky
post.summary: Mäyw haluun jumpinin :3 Just realized. Onha se tekeillä, mutta siinä saattaa kestää enneku se on valmis... ja siitä voi tulla vähä kälyne :p Facebook vittuilee miulle edelleen. Oikeessa laidassa ku on aina niitä sivuehdotuksia, ni AINA, VÄHINTÄÄN kolme viiestä on sellasia että "HÄN ja 3 muuta tykkäävät tästä" tai että vähintään siellä tykkääjien joukossa on tää sama nimi.. Ei niissä muuten mitää yhteistä ole, vaan tämä yks yhteinen tykkääjä .. Tai oon vainoharhanen :/ eilistä taas^ Oon kieltämättä vähä paska ihminen... Tajusin luoneeni uudesta ystävästä korvikkeen vanhalle. Asiat, mitkä olisin ennen selittäny vanhalle kaverille, selitän nyt tälle uudelle... Äh. Ei se kyllä ihan noinkaan oo, koska kyllä tää uus ystävä on miulle tärkee ihan omana ittenään eikä kakkosvaihtoehtona... Asiasta kukkaruukkuun apinat on sinisiä ja taateli. miälenvikasta. --- I heard that you're settled downThat you found a girl and you're married nowI heard that your dreams came trueGuess she gave you things I didn't give to you Old friend, why are you so shy?Ain't like you to hold back or hide from the light I hate to turn up out of the blue, uninvitedBut I couldn't stay away, I couldn't fight itI had hoped you'd see my face and that you'd be remindedThat for me, it isn't over... Never mind, I'll find someone like youI wish nothing but the best for you, tooDon't forget me, I begged, I remember you saidSometimes it lasts in love, but sometimes it hurts insteadSometimes it lasts in love, but sometimes it hurts instead You know how the time fliesOnly yesterday was the time of our livesWe were born and raised in a summer hazeBound by the surprise of our glory days I hate to turn up out of the blue, uninvitedBut I couldn't stay away, I couldn't fight itI had hoped you'd see my face and that you'd be remindedThat for me, it isn't over yet Never mind, I'll find someone like youI wish nothing but the best for you, tooDon't forget me, I begged, I remember you saidSometimes it lasts in love, but sometimes it hurts instead, yeah Nothing compares, no worries or caresRegrets and mistakes, they're memories madeWho would have known how bittersweet this would taste?.. Jne. En voi mitään että yksinkertasesti rakastan tuota biisiä. Vaikka se onki vähän angsti.., mutta niinhä mie oon? Tykkään ihan sikana. No matter what they say. Ohohhoh siinä toinen biisi johon äskettäin rakastuin, kiitos Katalle..: No matter what they say,I'm writing my own tale,I'm fighting my own way,And I will survive.No matter what they say,I've chosen my own way,To tell you my story,I know I'll survive.No matter what they say -- -- All alone and I feel I'm on burnin' ground,Hold my hands, let me know it'll turn around,Show me how to be strong I wanna stay alive,Oh yes now I know I will survive.All my life I had a dream I'm runnin' for,I see the sun come out I see the picture on my wall,I see the birds flying and the clear sky right,Over my head, over my head. ---- They can't judge me,They don't know me,I won't budge see,I walk my own streets,(Trust me) trust me,I've been lonely,Eyes wide shut...No matter what they say,I'm writing my own tale,I'm fighting my own way,And I will survive. No matter what they say,I've chosen my own way,To tell you my story,I know I'll survive.No matter what they say Miusta ja miun ajatusmaailmasta oppii paljon 1) musiikista jota kuuntelen (spotify on oivallinen siihe paitsi että viimeaikoina oon käyttäny toista spotifyy..) 2) lukemalla blogeja (tätä ja gallerian..) 3) selaamalla mitä kuvia oon hearttaillu we♥itissä. Tulee miun mielenliikkeet aika selväks. Mutta tietysti luotettavin on kysyminen ihan iteltäni :p paitsi että joskus en osaa selittää ni nuo yllämainitut toimii kätevämmin. *** Aihe vaihtuu kätevästi. En kirjota tästä sen takia, että miulle ehotettiin että tästä vois kirjottaa.. Kirjotan sen takii koska haluun. :) Pelkäsin alkuun ettei myö tultas ollenkaa toimeen. Pelkäsin etten oppis pitämään tästä. Mutta olin silti päättäny että kyllä tästä vielä hyvä tulee. Pakkohan sitä on oppia kestämään, parhaan kaverin poikaystävää. Aluks oli kyllä lievästi semmone mitä helvettiä nyt ihan oikeesti -olo.. Mutta kappas. Suunnilleen seittemän kuukautta on aikaa siitä ku tavattiin ekan kerran. Kuinkas tässä sitten kävikään. Jätkästä on tullu suunnilleen yks miun parhaista ystävistä :) Oikee taateli ;) Molemminpuolinen luottamus iha kiitettävällä tasolla: mie kerron aika pitkälle kaikki miun asiat.. Kait seki kertoo omansa :) Varmasti molemmilla on vielä opittavaa toisesta, myönnettäköön että on miussa ainaki vielä puolia mistä oon antanu näkyy varsin vähän vielä.. Mutta tulee ne esiin ajallaan jos on tullakseen :) On ollu erittäin mielenkiintosia keskusteluja (....) ja niitä on varmasti myös jatkossa :DVoin jo tässä vaiheessa sanoo että on ollu ihan sairaan hienoo saaha tutustuu noinki hienoon ihmiseen. Senki sanon, että miun elämä olis varmasti paljon, PALJON tylsempää ilman. Kenelle sitte avautusin aina miun säälittävistä luuseriongelmista, tietäen että ihan sama mikä millonki vituttaa tai on ongelmana tai muutenvaan painaa mieltä, ni se saa miut sanomisillaan paremmalle mielelle? Kuka sit osais melkeen vaistota miun ajatuksia? Kuka olis kysymässä, että onko kaikki ok sillon kun oon hiljanen? Kuka olis nyysimässä miun rannekoruja ja sormuksia? Kuka sit olis sanomassa miulle aina että oon ihan paloauton värinen? Kuka olis parantamassa maailmaa tavoilla, joita harvat ymmärtää? Kuka muu tekis parhaan kaverini onnellisimmaks mitä se on ikinä ollu? :)♥ Loppujen lopuks.. En olis ikinä uskonu että meistä tulee oikeesti näin hyvät ystävät. Mutta onneks ne pelot mitä miulla sillon aluks oli, on karissu jo aikaa sitten :) Ei voi ku vaan olla onnellinen että taateli on löytäny takas juurilleen! ^__^ *** Älkääkä vahingossakaan kysykö miks juttelen Ksylitolipojalle (.... eivittu hajoon itelleni XD). On ehkä yks ihminen joka ymmärtää miks juttelen sille (Ain't that right Sonja?) Sen kanssa vaan on tosi kiva jutustella. Jotenki niin rennon letkeetä ja huoletonta :) Okei kyllä miulle välillä tulee jotain fläshbäkkejä (iik, pelottaa♥, jne.) mutta ei ne häirihe samalla tapaa ku ne vois häiritä. Jotenki tuntuu että sen kanssa jutteleminen on irtiotto arjesta.. Koska se ei kuulu enää miun arkeen. Ei se oikeesti missään vaiheessa kuulunukkaa. Mesessä ja tekstareilla vaan. Myönnetään, olihan se ihanaa aikaa.., oli kokoajan jotenki utopinen olo. Haluttu. Tärkee. Paljon paskaa on tapahtunu sen jälkeen, mutta muistot niistä ajoista säilyy miun milessä varmaan ikuisesti, enkä kadu =) En haikaile, muistelen vaan lämmöllä♥.. Jos joku jonain päivänä saa aikaan samat tuntemukset miussa.. Noh, odotan sitä päivää innolla. Kyllä se vielä tulee :)

post.title: JSF #4: M.I.A - Maya - 2010
post.summary: Thème du jour: Hangover Sound Avant d'en arriver à la gueule de bois, il faut bien qu'il y ait eu excès. En clair, une bonne soirée passée en compagnie de Mr Jack D., Jim.B ou encore avec la vaporeuse Marie-Jeanne, cette verte Poison Ivy. Trop, trop vite, un verre, puis deux, un joint, musique trop forte, un autre verre puis encore un autre, black out, cuvette de chiotte, un joint, un verre, voiture, fossé, black out, cuvette de chiotte et ainsi de suite. Si bien que le lendemain on ne se souvient plus de grand chose, quelques flashs violents et à nouveau cette sempiternelle cuvette de chiotte. Soyons clair tout de suite, la musique je l'adore quand je fais la teuf' (ou la java pour les plus anciens, je connais vos âges maintenant), et cet album est un catalyseur de Hangover en devenir. Du cyberpunk utra-jouissif, du rock taliban explosant tout sur son passage, attentat à la bouteille piégée. Tronçonneuse, perceuse, electro-bruitiste, cette soirée sera une boucherie et "Steppin Up" ouvre glorieusement les hostilités. M.I.A réussit le tour de force d'amener des mélodies mainstream dans cette furia punk, parfois outrageusement dancefloor comme sur "Xxxo", mais toujours de manière ludique et insolente. Plus loin, "Born Free" sort Suicide et son "Ghost Rider" du CGBG pour les traîner à toute blinde accrochés à la moto enflammée du Ghost Rider de Marvel. Le clip "anti-roux" réalisé par Romain Gavras avait créé la polémique; l'ensemble formait un tout indispensable, diablement moderne. "Born Free" est une bombe atomique sonore sans concessions. "Maya", un album toxique et violent, synthétique mais jamais artificiel, assurément un grand disque. Et le lendemain de cuite dans tout ça? Partagé entre la vie et la mort, c'est le silence qui est de rigueur, désolé. Lien Spotify Rejoignez les Chroniques de Toorsch' sur Facebook.

post.title: Frågor
post.summary: Fyra frågor om förhållanden. Är du singel ? Ja tyvärr Tror du på kärlek vid första ögonkastet ? Ja Hur många har du varit kär i? Eh nt en aning, blir lätt kär 😏 Är du kär just nu? Nae Tio frågor om dig själv. Namn? Ida Linnéa Jernér När fyller du år? 6 juli Några piercingar? Öronen, vill ha fler på andra ställen Vad har du på dig just nu? post.title: Svar på frågestunden.
post.summary:
Sara Varför började du blogga? Jag vet faktiskt inte, ville väl ha någonstans att skriva av mig & såg det nog mest som tidsfördriv i början. Vad brukar du oftast göra på helgerna? Antingen så är jag hemma med familjen eller kanske ute & festar eller umgås med vänner. Vart redigerar du dina bilder & hur gör du oftast? :) Jag redigerar mina bilder i photoshop cs5 & jag gör olika varje gång jag redigerar en bild oftast, men brukar för det mesta ändra i curves för att ändra ljuset osv. Saraaa Vad står de på din tatto vid halsen :) På min tatuering vid halsen står det ''Death must work hard to get me''.
Julia Vem har vart den bästa pojkvännen du haft? Har ju knappt haft pojkvänner, och har aldrig haft någon som varit sådär bra för mig så ingen faktiskt. Sen till den du INTE får ta illa vid dig av! Varför färgar du håret så mycket när du engång raka av dig allt för att det var så slitet haha. Är du inte orolig för att du ska behöva göra samma sak igen?:o Haha jag vet faktiskt inte, men tycker inte om utväxt som man får så himla lätt av att vara blond & vill inte vara svarthårig så jag måste ju färga till, och jo självklart är jag orolig, men kommer aldrig raka av mig allt igen, isåfall klippa mig kort. Kevin Somnat under sex någon gång? Japp, på fyllan dock, but still count. Ångrar du någon du varit tillsammans med? Haha japp det gör jag verkligen! Vem är den bästa du har legat med? Alla är bra på olika sätt, har ingen som varit bäst av alla direkt. Skulle du kunna träffa/dejta mig? :) Känner ingen Kevin så har ingen aning vem du är så nja vet faktiskt inte.. Ha en bra dag. Sören Charmören Blir det friktion av luften i höga hastigheter i vacuum? Hahaha eftersom jag inte får använda google till svar på frågorna så vet jag faktiskt inte.. Hur många My är en lackerad yta oftast? My..? Vad är det för något? Hur många prickar kan en giraff som mest ha? 122484564 stycken Är zebran svart med vita ränder eller vit med svarta ränder? Vit med svarta ränder såklart!! Hur länge ska betong brinna innan man kan hälla vatten på det? Måste det brunnit en viss tid? o.o Hur mycket kostar i snitt en prostituerad i långtbortistan? Hahah fråga någon som bor där vettja! Hur långt är ett snöre? Så långt du vill ha det. Är homo och bög samma sak? Jajamen! Är bögar som lesbiska fast tvärtom? Precis. Får man ha freoner i en modern AC? Say what..? Äter rävar frukt och potatis? Det gör dom säkert, dom äter väl vad som helst, hungriga jävlar dedär! Vad var det för dag 19-04-1782? Det var en fredag. Vem sköt Palme? Säg det inte till någon.. men, det var faktiskt jag... Hahah seriöst, förstår inte hur ni orkade komma på frågorna (ja det var då 3 personer från jobbet som hade roligt & ställde mig dom här frågorna) Caroline Du verkar vara en störtskön brud med bra smak för kläder & musik, kan du inte länka någon spellista du har på spotify & säga vart du oftast köper dina kläder & accesoarer? Tackar så mycket! Sitter tyvärr på fel dator just nu för det, men någon gång kan jag göra ett inlägg med några spellistor. Jag köper mina kläder oftast på bikbok eller gina tricot, eller junkyard, där köper jag oftast stora oversize hoods. Anonym Vart redigerar du dina bilder? Photoshop cs5
Hoppas ni är nöjda med svaren!

post.title: Sam & the Womp – Bom Bom
post.summary: Listen to Sam And The Womp - Bom Bom - Radio Edit (2,9 min) on spotify. Bom Bom - Radio Edit can be found on the album Bom Bom which were released 2012, track nr: 1About Sam & the WompSam and the Womp are a British based eight piece music group who formed in 2009 and have created a unique alternative disco sound. Their music mixes traditional elements of Balkan music and Jamaican ska with modern electronic and dance elements. The band also have their own dance named, the "Womp", which is fairly idiosyncratic and uninhibited. Their music has been largely popularised by BBC Radio 1 with a heavy promotion of their single "Bom Bom". They released their debut single "Bom Bom" on iTunes on 19 August 2012 and the single went to the number one spot in the UK midweek charts and are firmly positioned for a first week number one. As of 2012 they are signed to Stiff Records, a record label rooted in the modern indie scene. The band's first single "Bom Bom" was released in August 2012 and features a euphoric and light hearted sound which seems to have universal appeal. The lead singer on the track is Bloem de Ligny who is also a solo artist. Other members of the band to feature on the track include band creator Sam Ritchie, who plays trumpet on the track and Aaron Horn who features as DJ and producer. last.fm More: Sam & the Womp Li tvingas skilja sig för att få byta kön Music video with Sam & the WompHere you can find videos from Youtube with Sam & the Womp - Bom BomWatch the official video for Bom Bom by Sam and the Womp. post.title: Zara
post.summary:
On olemassa kaksi ämmää joista pidän aivan erityisen paljon, muoti ja musiikki. Niinpä se että Ruotsista juuri näiltä aloilta löytyy niinkin paljon menestystarinoita on todella kiva juttu. Muotiteollisuudella, ja nyt en siis puhu vain H&Mstä, menee hyvin. Monet nuoret ruotsalaiset merkit ovat muutamassa vuodessa kasvaneet isohkoiksi, tuottaviksi yrityksiksi mitkä myös pönkittävät Ruotsin vientiteollisuutta mukavasti. Hieno homma! Maailmalla Ruotsi taas taitaa nykyään olla IKEAn ohella ihmisille kaikkein tunnetuin musiikistaan – Abba, Roxette, Robyn ja Swedish House Mafia ovat tehneet maalle loistavaa PR:ää. Tällä hetkellä täällä Ruotsissa sekä iTunesin että Spotifyn ekalla sijalla keikkuu äskettäin 15 vuotta täyttänyt Zara Larsson. Zara, joka muuten on Nathalie Schutermanin bloggaajatyttären Chloen hyvä ystävä, voitti vain 10-vuotiaana Ruotsin Talang-kilpailun mahtavalla esiintymisellä. Nyt nuorelta naiselta on tullut EP jonka sinkkulohkaisu “Uncover” lupaa hyvää. Kauniin Zaran Rihannamainen laulutyyli yhdistettynä nuoreen ikään ja tarttuvaan melodiaan on täällä uponnut kansaan. Mitä pidätte?
Svenskar är bra på mycket, bland annat på mode och musik. Jag tycker det är imponerande hur många unga modemärken som på några år lyckats växa till framgångsrika modeföretag. Fantastiskt! I stora världen är Sverige, förutom IKEA, säkerligen mest känt för musiken – Abba, Roxette, Robyn och Swedish House Mafia. Just nu toppas Spotify- och iTunes singlelistan av 15-åriga Zara Larsson (ni vet hon som vann Talang redan för fem år sedan och är kompis med Chloe Schuterman). Visst är låten bra? Heja heja!

post.title: Avslapping
post.summary: Har brukt dagen min så langt til shopping og litt avslapping. Denne uken, for første gang på evigheter kjente jeg at jeg virkelig trengte og ta helg, og at det har vært greit å koble litt ut. Har så langt koset meg med familie, kino, shopping og god mat. Akkurat slik det skal være i helgen. Godt å lade opp litt krefter. Det har vel egentlig ikke skjedd så veldig mye spesielt denne uken, annet enn at jeg kjenner at kreftene mine er helt borte. Har blant annet snart brukt opp Spotify tiden min på gudene vet hvor lang tid. Bra jeg netopp ar vært og kjøpt meg en kurt nilsen cd. Føler blant annet at jeg må begynne å prestere bedre, spesielt i jobbsammenheng og har engentlig ikke en anelse om hvordan jeg skal klare det. Jeg er blid og positiv, men uheldigvis en smule litt for forsiktig og mindre frempå enn jeg skulle ønske. Har i det siste startet og tenkt litt på hva jeg skal gjøre til høsten. Skole eller jobb? Har vel egentlig tenkt at jeg starter med jobb så får jeg se på skoleplanene mine etterhvert. Men hvor vil jeg arbeide? Hvor vil jeg søke og finne de utfordringene jeg vil ha? Tenker en del i gjennom dette da jeg skal på en jobbsamtale etter hvert hvor blant annet disse spørsmålene blir stilt. Vil jeg fortsette der jeg er nå eller begynne et nytt sted? Men foreløpig har jeg ingen svar. Kanskje jeg har slappet av og latt være å tenke på veldig mange spørsmål alt for lenge, som nå er kommet for å kreve snart. Dette er imidlertid en lørdag jeg har nytt. På mandag har jeg planer om å vaske rundt, ta i bruk alt det nye som jeg har kjøpt. Hvis jeg ikke gjør det i morgen da. Får se hvor lenge jeg sover da. Føltes godt å skrive dette innlegg. Ikke alt som er like lett og snakke høyt om, men nå føles det litt bedre Takk hvis du leser dette. (Bildet er i fra google

post.title: Fasiten for musikkåret 2013 tar form
post.summary: Ting skjer fort i våre dager, og jeg har for lengst begynt arbeidet med Fasiten for musikkåret 2013. Så langt teller den fattige 13 låter – 12 i Wimp-versjonen – men den kommer selvsagt til å vokse seg stadig større og mer uregjerlig etter som ukene går. Fjorårets liste endte opp med en spilletid på over et døgn, så jeg anbefaler at du klikker på «subscribe»-knappen først som sist. Spotify-brukere finner Fasiten her, og Wimp-folk finner den der. Jeg minner også om at jeg minst en gang i uken legger ut nye musikkanmeldelser i en egen blogg. Så langt i år har jeg skrevet om de nye platene til Graveyard, Kris Kristofferson, Yo La Tengo og Aaron Neville. Dessuten har jeg vært på konsert med Tønes. Kort sagt: 2013 ligger an til å bli et bra musikkår.

post.title: Daughter
post.summary:
Gæsteindlæg: Stinus Kirkeskov Trioen Daughter har for mig betydet rigtig meget. Ikke kun musikalsk, hvor jeg synes de er noget af det ypperste indiefolk/folkrock der findes, men også personligt har de præget mig. Derfor er det med meget stor glæde, at jeg opdagede at de lige nu har udgivet singlen Smother med B-siden Run. Mit første møde med dem var på Roskilde Festivalen 2012 på intimscenen Gloria. En scene, der klædte dem forfærdeligt godt med sit lave loft, nærhed til bandet og flotte performancekunstinstallation med lys og projektor. Stedet var tilpas lille til, at man som publikum fik lov til at stå tæt og opleve melankolien brede sig. Helt klart en af mine bedste koncerter på det års Roskilde, og der var ellers mange om buddet. Og siden da er kærligheden til Elena Tonra (sangerinde og guitarist), Igor Haefeli (guitarist) og Remi Aguilella (trommer) bare vokset og vokset. Elena startede med at være alene om projektet, men hurtigt fik hun fat i vennerne Igor og Remi, og udgivelsen af deres første EP His Young Heart (april 2011) var en realitet. En EP der primært var meget forsagt og folket med sangen Landfill som knudepunkt.
Hurtigt fulgte The Wild Youth (oktober 2011) der bød på lidt mere vildskab og gåsehudsfremkaldende crescendo, hvor nøglenumret Youth virkelig viste, hvilket potentiale London gruppen har.
Nu har bandet så signet med det meget anerkendte label 4AD (andre markante bands i stalden: The National, Bon Iver, Deerhunter og Grimes). Så man kan roligt sige, at de tre ydmyge englændere er kommet i fint selskab. Heldigvis er deres musikalske niveau også i verdensklasse, og det demonstrerer de igen på singlen Smother og B siden Run. Udtrykket er ikke meget anderledes end på de to foregående EP’er, hvilket ikke gør noget, for hvorfor ændre på noget, der fungerer eminent i forvejen.
Daughters første fuldlængde album If You Leave udkommer den 30. marts, og jeg glæder mig umådeligt! Som om det ikke var nok, så gæster trioen også København nærmere bestemt Lille Vega den 10 april. Lige præcis den dato vil jeg med sikkerhed befinde mig inde på Lille Vegas beskidte gulv, og endnu engang nyde melankolien brede sig blandt de fremmødte. Kunne jo være at du også kom til midnatsmessen. Jeg vil hvert fald anbefale dig det.
Daughter | Homepage Daughter | Facebook Daughter | Spotify Daughter | Soundcloud Daughter | Bandcamp

post.title: Recollection: The Best of Concrete Blonde
post.summary: A few folks reading this might remember a band by that name and if not they might more easily recall the one single they were successful with on the pop charts, namely a song called Joey in the early nineties. There was much more to Concrete Blonde than that however. If you were around in the late eighties in Maine and were a rock fan it seems likely you listened at times to WBLM. This radio station which I still admit to tuning in on my trips to southern Maine, I could listen online anytime I want but forget to, dominated a segment of the market at that time. WBLM loved Concrete Blonde. Many of the songs that you will find on this Best of Collection were songs we all heard on WBLM long before this band ever broke nationally. From True, Still in Hollywood, Dance Along the Edge, God is A Bullet, Tomorrow Wendy, to Ghost of a Texas Ladies Man this band was making great, original, music all through the late eighties. For those who are going down this memory lane with me I wonder how many remember how often the band played at Raoul's Roadside Attraction on Forest Avenue. I remember seeing them a couple of times and I think that I missed them a few times. This was a band, loved and promoted by a radio station in a small market that created a hotspot of fans for them long before and long after their national success. Hearing Joey on the satellite today made all these memories come flooding back and I listened to this collection on Spotify. One could find much worse way to spend an hour than by spending this hour down memory lane.

post.title: Musique et Moi - Passenger
post.summary: Vandaag weer een Musique et Moi. Daar heb ik namelijk even zin in. Ik ben op het moment ongelofelijk veel bezig met school, omdat het eind van het kwartaal nadert (lees: nu is afgelopen) en zo ook de proefwerkweek. Op dit soort momenten is een muziekje erbij altijd fijn. En omdat ik Passenger gewoon een ontzettend toffe zanger vind, is hij het onderwerp van deze Musique et Moi. Ja. Zoals iedereen ken ik Passenger van het nummer Let her go. Maar toen ik even zijn hele album ging luisteren via Spotify kwamen er op mysterieuze wijze steeds meer van zijn nummers op mijn afspeellijst terecht en nu staat ongeveer het hele album erop. Wat vinden jullie van Passenger? En welke muziek luisteren jullie op het moment? Lots of Love, Jasmijn

post.title: It's OK UK
post.summary: It's OK UKWatching the news and checking my Twitter feed is getting gloomy. Even amongst Paris Fashion Week and Michelle O's inauguration dress choice, there is no escape down time from the news that keeps on growing in disappointment and effect. This trend that is changing our culture, economy, high street face, is about the domino closures, the big names that are following to the dreaded tune of the Pied Piper's administration. In the space of just days I hear three big names going through the sad process including Jessops, HMV and Blockbusters - all have gone into administration. Jessops was not a huge shock, it's the results of our obsession, love and second nature behaviour of sharing, storing and viewing our photos online that has changed our attitude to the way we take that image in the first place. How many smart phone giants advertise the camera and sharing functionality as core feature? As soon as I got my iPhone 4S, I gave my much loved but no longer needed Canon digital to charity (yes I got that from you Jessops). I knew really honestly, that I would never buy a digital camera ever again. I had separated myself into that category of an individual who loves capturing imagery and being able to share as easy as a swipe, from the actual photographer who would own a whizz bang beast of SLR type. It was a pivotal moment of being able to do more, with less. Just how this instant gratification society expects. I did wonder about the buyers market of professional cameras and equipment - surely that was an obvious gateway for Jessops e-commerce? But then how many online companies were doing this a few moons ago? Too late to play in that game. HMV sparked a lot of debate on Facebook, it seemed that many people had some personal brand association with them whether it be that they brought their first album in store or the fact that it was a great place to hang out on a Sunday trawling through music and DVDs with like minded folk. It's sad to see the last high street music baron close it's doors. This sparked off a conversation at my agency about how we actually buy music. Do you still buy music?iTunes, Spotify and more, look no further it's all there and even better it feeds your smart phone or tiny gorgeous aluminium device, plus it's smarter than that CD that stored 13 tracks. It seemed only natural that the business of buying music was changing it's financial landscape with very visible movements that I'm surprised HMV hadn't reinvented themselves to some degree. The rebranding was not the most crucial change I feel that it was crying out for. More the experience had to change, adapt and reflect the forward evolving consumer market and look to be at the forefront of technology where possible and therefore deliver something truly meaningful. I'm wondering what this all means and shudder at the thought of the British high street changing so much due to the Pied Piper's song that we might end up with increasingly empty retail units and a feeling of abandoned hope in once prosperous towns. Is this changing the way we shop? But I have to say it can't be all that bad, I only have to think about Burberry on Regent Street and that is an excellent example of how shopping, buying, consumer behaviour has been integrated into the physical store it's self and purged out through digital mediums. The space within feels just like the crafted elegance of the Burberry brand offering, but its more of a marriage between store and Burberry.com. You won't lose out. The interactive mirrors transform into personalised screens, this means if you bring an item close by the screen transforms into a runway showcasing that product or may give a 360 degree overview. Global events are screened live on a mammoth of a digital screen, it's very much the feature of the store , not necessarily a physical item of clothing itself. I was invited to watch new band talent play a gig as an exclusive ... but they weren't actually there if you see what they're doing ; ) The store can break into audio visual choreography at any time and suddenly your amid gushing rainfall ( trench anyone?) and they have intuitively created a space where shopping, culture and our digital needs are coming together, ready to play together. Even if this feels too much or shoppers may not yet be fully ready for the whole experience? The remarkable factor is the adaptation and innovative moves the brand has made and the focus on key touch points of what online buyers love about shopping - bringing them together in the place where it all started. A shop. So I have a feeling that a future retail trend will see more of our high street favourites opting to include digital and social into the fibre of store experience. Changing how we shop, but still keeping stores open so the essence of 'shopping' is still exactly that.

post.title: Unexpected Running Songs #11-15
post.summary: It’s been another week and by now you may getting a little tired of the first 10 unexpected running songs. Lucky for you it’s time for another batch, and these 5 should keep you entertained for quite a while. At least until next weekend, of course. Here’s what we got: 1. I’ve Been Everywhere by Johnny Cash (3:11) I have to have an oldie on the list and I don’t know if you can find a better ‘oldie’ than Johnny Cash. This randomly came on today and I had a blast running to it. There are probably quite a few other hidden gems for running from Mr. Cash. 2. Reboot the Mission by The Wallflowers (3:32) This is one of my favorite songs right now and I go crazy when it comes on the radio. That normally translates to the trail pretty well. I think everyone should give this a chance, regardless of your current opinion of The Wallflowers. 3. What? by Rob Zombie (2:46) Don’t judge me too hard with this one. It’s Rob Zombie. It’s inappropriate. It’s about dead people and what not, but it’s about as metal/rock as you can get, and a power song like no power song before. I actually discovered this song a few months ago by Shazaming it from a sidewalk next to a guy in a Jeep that was blasting it, and it’s been one of my favorites since. Just don’t look too deep into the lyrics, of course. 4. Brimful of Asha, Norman Cook Mix by Cornershop (3:57) Fun song that randomly played the first day I got Spotify, and it may be why I still use it today. I have never heard this one until then and it’s a song that you think you should have heard before. The Norman Cook mix is icing on the cake. 5. Tick Tick Boom by The Hives (3:26) In the past I have said my iPod plays quite a bit of country, but as you can tell, this week it was in a rock out kinda mood. I didn’t complain one bit. If you haven’t heard this one, you should. If you don’t like it for running, you’ll find some other times to play it. Great pump-up song. So there you have it! If you put all of 5 of these on in a row I wouldn’t be surprised if you see a new mile time PR. I was pretty excited to share this weeks list with you all. Next weekend there will be 5 fresh songs, and if you have the perfect one for the list, please let me know! Just comment below and let me know what’s your go-to power songs. Happy running!

post.title: Deutsche nutzen Facebook in Europa am wenigsten!
post.summary:
Deutsche verbringen die geringste Zeit in Facebook Wer hätte das gedacht, das soziale Netzwerk ist auch in Deutschland sehr angesagt – jedoch liegt Deutschland sehr weit hinten, was die tägliche Nutzung des Dienstes betrifft! Zusammen mit Frankreich bildet Deutschland das Schlusslicht mit 2,3 Stunden tägliche Nutzung! Danach folgt England mit 2,4 Stunden Facebook pro Tag!! Wer das nun für viel hält der hat die Nutzung von türkischen Nutzern noch nicht gesehen, welche mit 4,9 Stunden an der Spitze liegen! Doch dies ist noch nicht die Spitze des Eisberges, wenn eine weltweite Auswertung fährt! Denn die Bewohner von Indonesien und Saudi-Arabien erreichen hier einen durchschnittlichen Spitzenwert von 5,1 Stunden pro Tag! Wenn ich mir diese Zahlen so ansehe, muss es dort draußen in der großen weiten Welt tatsächlich Leute geben, welche den ganzen lieben Tag in sozialen Netzwerken verbringen! Kaum vorstellbar – aber muss ja wohl so sein, wenn man dieser Befragung glauben schenken mag.
[Quelle: Auswertung von n-tv]
Vielleicht auch noch interessant:
Facebook – Top – Check-Ins der Welt
Spotify ohne Facebook nutzen

post.title: Franklin Vanderbilt Sings Unplugged for Sandy Hook + Great INFO on this artist!!
post.summary:
~IB~ continuing our 3 part series on Franklin Vanderbilt, bringing you right up to speed with the latest from this surprisingly multi-talented man! Just listen to the above beautiful performance of, ‘Everybody’s Talking About Love,’ a song written by Franklin, dedicated to all those affected by the recent Sandy Hook tragedy. It is reflective of Franklin’s belief in the power of love. When asked for a quote to go with the song, Franklin said, ’LOVE IN THIS WORLD STILL EXIST.’ That is the truth. Whatever bad happens in the world we need to understand that love is ultimately the strongest force possible and will shine through.
Back to basics!
We have already checked out Franklin’s larger than life personality, worthy of any superstar!! So, let’s just observe a few facts relating to his musical roots so we can put all you new fans in the picture!
Franklin is a naturally gifted drummer, initially from the West side of Chicago, who was born into a musical family. Aged 5, Franklin was given a seriously good drumkit, a Ludwig, and went on to endorse his family’s belief in him by ultimately appearing on stage with world renowned artists such as legendary funk singer Chaka Khan- who whisked him off to drume in LA for two and a half years, Stanley Clarke- known for his brand of jazz fusion and guitarist/singer/songwriter Richie Kotzen.
Prior to this, I believe Franklin’s personality must have shone alongside his talent, enabling him to receive tuition from many well known jazz and blues artists during his teenage years... check website link below for full details. Having played his part in both school and church musical events and having clearly thrived off the influence of his Uncle Robert Vanderbilt, Franklin grew up with a serious, dedicated approach to music which combined with his tremendous energy formed the foundation of his career. Franklin's efforts caught Greg Parker’s attention, (look him up!) a blessings as Greg helped young Franklin venture into new genres which included rock. This proved extremely beneficial enabling Franklin to play with one of the world’s greatest musicians, Stevie Wonder in 2005 and his great talent was soon spotted by Rock star Lenny Kravitz, whom he has supported since 2007- present.
Back in 2008 I remember Franklin telling me that he wrote his own songs and he has also learnt to play the guitar. These talents are now being put to good use as Franklin recently recorded 2 singles which are available on iTunes, Spotify, Amazon and Deezer. You have already heard the unplugged version of, ‘Everybody’s Talking About Love,’- check out the full instrumental version... and his other song, ‘ALIVE,’-WOW, Franklin just totally rocks it!!
‘This crazy place they call my brain..... I think I’m gonna go insane,’
we can all identify with these strong lyrics however, as I said to Franklin, if sanity ultimately rules.. we’re OK!
Final thought, looking forward to our interview with Franklin!!! And equally to his first album, based on the promise which has been successfully delivered in Franklin’s debut singles.
Big up to Royalprince!
Franklin’s website: http://www.franklin-vanderbilt.com/index.php?id=45
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/franklinvanderbilt.tallguydrummer
Jaz McKenzie

post.title: BBC Radio 1 too many
post.summary: First of all, thanks for all the positive things being said about the blog. I didn't think anyone would actually take time to read through any of the posts so thanks for being here! Tonight, I'd like to talk about something that bugs me most mornings on the way into uni (when my flatmate isn't playing her McFly nonsense that is). That bug, is BBC Radio 1. I'll start on a positive note shall I? Radio 1 are on a constant look-out for up-and-coming bands. Last year, they unearthed acts such as Little Comets (who played the introducing stage at Leeds fest), Seasfire and Hey Sholay. It's a personal aim of mine to actually make a band one day and the 'introducing' scheme seems to be a good start. They offer loads of little tips online and you can upload onto their website - so well done radio 1, top job! But I want to talk about the other side of radio 1; the side that seems to play whatever music it bloody well wants. Well, its a radio station, I hear you say. They can do that, right? Well I was sat there the other day, when Walk came on, the super awesome track from Foo Fighters. Yeah, I said 'super awesome' what you gonna do about it? Radio 1 tend to play this song religiously, forgetting that the band actually have countless other hits that listeners would equally enjoy. Nevertheless, it still got me tapping my toes and smashing out my air guitar, making me look like a right d*ckhead at the lights. But thats just me, if a song is worth singing to, why not at the traffic lights? Anyway, next on the radio was my all time 'I want to punch that person' chart topper. To me, the anti-Christ. the bane of my life. The ultimate douchebag of music. The one, the only. Nicki Minaj, with, what I can only describe as an abomination- I was too busy moaning about it to realise what was playing. (Note: I haven't put her name in Italics... She doesn't deserve them, she's not an artist). Anyway, that finally ended after what seemed an eternity. Then after some chatting from presenter, Nick Grimshaw, he played some sh*tty track that just said the word 'Clique' about 500 times in a row. That was it for me, I went for the power button on the radio, before my flatmate slapped me and put it back on. Harsh times... Anyway, my point is people, why do radio 1 play such a variety of music in one show? They have designated hours when everyone is either out in town or in bed. The rock show, the surgery (where people ring up and tell everyone listening (in complete confidence of course) how depressed they are and ask how to deal with it). Hell, radio 1 even set up a completely new station (radio 1 xtra) for all those who like to listen to music while they go round looking for people to mug and houses to rob. Yeah, I said it. They even bloody invade radio 1 of a Saturday night! So they have these designated hours where a particular genre is played, but every other time they try to play a variety. Who in their right mind does this: Oooo yay, Foo fighters! I like to rock out to something that really gets the blood going, you know? Oooo yay Nicki Minaj! I like to listen to music that repeats itself and sounds like the last track released, you know? Oooo yay! Some random black music! I like to, well just listen to sh*t, init? Who? Nobody. Now, if you want to listen to Nicki Minaj, thats fine by me; i'll just stand about 5 miles away while you do. That's not what this is about. What my point is, is that it is hard to listen to radio 1 and enjoy a string of songs that are played consecutively. I wouldn't mind if radio 1 decided to play chart music, because, to be fair to Miss Minaj, some people actually like her, and yes she's in the charts. So go ahead and play her. But why try to play stuff that isn't in the charts with it? I just dont get it. It seems to me radio are trying to be that kid on the yard who tries to be a jack-of-all-trades; the one who wil try to blend in with every crowd in the class. The one who is always there, but never around. In some ways, they have succeeded in this- constantly gaining a lot of listeners. But its not all that simple. There was a big overhaul in radio 1 a couple of years ago, with 'older' DJ's being replaced with newer 'younger' DJ's. Those high figures are on the slide once again. And it's no wonder! How can you keep the masses happy by trying to play everything? Look at XFM. They play rock music. Simple. They have a steady following and dedicate themselves to (in my opinion) quality music. Classic FM. Are they going to play Beethoven's 3rd, followed by 'smack my bitch up'? Probably not. It seems to me Radio 1 try too hard to be 'cool'. They have a philosophy where they try to appeal to every young person out there, and that is just impossible. So why try? Why not identify the most popular genre and stick to that? I just don't understand it! Anyway, I'll carry on making my spotify playlists and listen to the stuff I want to. And from now on I'll be taking my earphones around with me at all times, just in case that horrible anti-Christ springs up on me. Evil doer! Thanks for reading! Adios Rob

post.title: Things I Loved / Hated This Week #16
post.summary:
LOVE: Vegetarian:
I wrote extensively about this in my film blog this week, so I won’t rapturously go on and on, but I love everything about being a vegetarian. There is such a simple joy in knowing that nothing you’re eating had to die for you to do it. Instead, I have an entire world of new and exciting things to try. I used to think fruits and vegetables were unpalatable, but now, I find them full of flavor and thrilling. I eat grapefruit regularly as a dessert! It’s madness, (It’s carpet madness! Holla at the Ab Fab reference!) but it’s wonderful. I know that many people might think that it’s a restrictive diet, but that turns out not to be the case, I still eat way too much! When I decided to do this years ago, I thought it would be difficult and that I’d never be able to eat the things I used to love, like boeuf bourguignon ever again. I was wrong. You can make it much more simply with mushrooms and it’s even more delicious than it is with chunked up cows!
I received Martha Stewart’s latest cookbook, Meatless, in the post this week and I cannot wait to try out all the recipes. Give Meatless Monday a try, or just go vegetarian. I can go to almost any restaurant and find something to eat, it’s not a difficult thing to do at all. Macarons in Convection Oven:
Ever since the first time I went to IKEA, I have been obsessed by this gigantic oven they used to sell. I don’t think they do anymore, which is a shame. It was about $2000 and I lusted over it. I thought it would be the best thing to ever happen to me with its extra large oven, sleek stainless steel, and gorgeous gas cooktop. On one visit, I saw it in the discount section. Somebody had bought one and discovered a dent in it. Allegedly, that was the only issue, so I bought it for half price. I felt so clever. My father and I went up to pick it up and stopped for some delicious Indian food on the way home. Then, the oven sat for some time in my kitchen. I didn’t know how to set it up, so a professional had to come out. It only kind of worked. I was pissed. The gas worked beautifully, but the oven, the part that I was most excited for, did not. Two Whirpool specialists came out several times and finally got it running. A wire had been loose. A single little wire! Now it works well. I haven’t done as much baking as I expected to, so on Tuesday, I was excited to host Lollipopalooza, where Alison and I did a bunch of baking. We made challah bread and orange lollipops and grapefruit macarons. I am so ecstatic with the way the convection feature of the oven cooked the macarons. They puffed up beautifully, aren’t brown at all, and are magnificently delicate. My old oven made them rather crispy and they took a few days to mature. Not in the convection oven. I think I’ll make my macarons exclusively on convection now. Simple things like that thrill me. Making Cocktails:
Pretty drinks are fun. Drinking them is fun. Putting them together is fun. Drinks! I bought a bottle of Campari last week to make a batch of grapefruit macarons and have been experimenting with it ever since. I’ve created a concoction that I call a Nicky on the Rock. (Nicky is the name I’d rather have and on the rock because I pour it over a single ice cube into an antique champagne glass.) In a cocktail shaker, I mix: blood orange syrup, lime juice, orange juice, and top it with Campari. Shake until the shaker frosts, pour out, and enjoy. Also, the word cocktail is hilarious for reasons any immature person will understand. Push Button Switches:
I’m immediately delighted whenever I see a home with push button switches–even if it’s only in a magazine or on television. I don’t think there is a more elegant piece of electric hardware in existence. I don’t understand why we have moved to switches. Switches are plain and uninteresting and very demode. Push button switches are the very soul of fashion. Someday, the lighting in whatever home or apartment or cottage I end up calling my own will be exclusively controlled by the charming click of a pearly push button. I’ve never seen them for sale in stores, but you can easily find them on the Internet. Bless the Internet. New iTunes Color Schemes on Albums:
I don’t know why it took me so long to notice this, but now that I have, I’m delighted. I’m really loving the latest release of iTunes, even though I don’t use it nearly as much as I used to since I am using Spotify a lot now. Great service that I highly recommend. It can be annoying when you can’t find the music you want, but you can discover a lot of new music that you never knew you’d like. Anyway, the new iTunes is absolutely gorgeous and the way you browse your music is really very nice. All your albums are arranged by artist and then album title. When you click on one, the album expands into an attractive little window that lists the tracks and shows the artwork. A delightful thing it does, though, is the window takes on the color scheme of the album. So, if there is a lot of blue in the image, the background will be blue. It’s little touches like those that make me adore Apple more and more. HATE: “Bucolic”:
I am so very tired of hearing this word. It seems to be in every single blog and magazine. People who become farmers love talking about living “the bucolic life” and rapture on endlessly about the delight of fresh eggs and greens. Shut up! There is nothing so fabulous about rummaging around in the dirt and picking up crap covered eggs. I am not knocking people who lead this lifestyle, not at all, but I hate the way that it’s idealized with fancy vocabulary. I do enjoy gardening and fresh duck eggs, but it’s not that great. Your fingernails get dirt under them and it never comes out, bugs eat your arugula, the ducks are filthy and relieve themselves everywhere, the days are long and you’re always dirty and you’ll probably die of skin cancer in the long run. So, farm all you want if you like it, I like to garden, but stop saying bucolic and stop trying to convince me that wild animals are singing and dancing around while you savor a fresh egg. I’m not buying it. Boxer Briefs:
I am very particular when it comes to underwear. I’ve never liked boxers–what are they supposed to do exactly? Why wear them if everything is still going to swing about? I’ve always preferred briefs and jockstraps–they hold everything together quite nicely. My favorite brand by far is Andrew Christian–fashionable, fun, and exceedingly comfortable. A few months ago they had a grab bag sale, so, of course I bought one. Inside was a mesh tshirt, (where am I going to wear that?) briefs and the lovely pair of boxer briefs you can see above. I sighed at them–I don’t ever wear them. So, they’ve been sitting on a shelf for a while until I finally put them on a few days ago. Did I like it at first? No. My thighs, which are not large by any means, felt like they were being cut off from my circulation. But, they stretched a bit during the day, so it wasn’t dreadful. In fact, the leg rolled up a bit which made me wonder what the point is. Why not have the freedom of movement that briefs and underwear like them offer? But, later on, as I was getting undressed that day, I took a look at my posterior. Then I looked again. Then I stopped, moved to a larger mirror and studied what I saw. Somehow, and only the sweet baby Buddha knows how, those underwear gave me an ass. I don’t have one. Yet, there it was, looking back at me alluringly. It was very dramatic, you must understand. I have been doing a new exercise regime that includes a lot of squats, but I haven’t been doing it long enough to see results like that. If I’m ever going to walk around in my underwear in front of a crowd, those will be the pair I pick, if not in my everyday wear. I took a picture, and debated posting it. I thought no, then I said, whatever. Here you go.
Kidz Bop: I was browsing through the latest releases on Spotify last night to find some new music to fill the sadness in my life until Beyoncé or Gaga or Britney releases some new music. I thought Justin Timberlake would help, but that new song of his is dumb. It’s starting to grow on me, but not fully. How do you dance to that? Let’s try, shall we?
Did you figure it out? I didn’t. Anyway, as I was scrolling, I came across Kidz Bop, listened to a track to laugh, and found myself getting pissed off. First off: Kidz. Really? We already have low literacy levels and you’re going to misspell a simple word on an album for children? Second: what is with the singing? It sucks! Third: why does this exist at all? Children don’t want to hear their peers slaughtering Rihanna’s annoying “Diamonds,” they want to hear Rihanna. Avoid these albums. Pedestrian White Chocolate:
I have never ever liked white chocolate. I much prefer dark chocolate. Turns out, I’ve just never had a good white chocolate. I’ve always used Ghirardelli in my baking and thought that is the way it was supposed to taste. What a shock to discover that I was wrong. I hate that. During the holidays, Whole Foods was selling big chunks of Callebaut white chocolate and I picked some up out of curiosity. Alison and I used it for the grapefruit macarons and I was astounded by the flavor. It doesn’t taste cloyingly sweet–it’s every bit as rich and delicious as dark chocolate with a hint of smokiness. That is an elegant chocolate and I shall never go back to common grocery store varieties. I hope Whole Foods will carry it throughout the year and if not, I hope they will special order it for me. It’s really a revelation to me. New Google Image Search: I rely on Google’s image search for the images that go on many of my blog posts, so I am very frustrated by the convoluted new system that they are using. It’ll grow with me in time, perhaps, but I doubt it. I don’t like all the clicking and the pictures don’t get bigger and when you click on the results you go to the actual page that hosts the picture. No me gusto.

post.title: cause' nothing could ever, ever replace
post.summary:
Hallo! Nu har jag precis tittat klart senaste avsnittet av Vampire Diaries. Och ni som vill titta på de absolut senaste avsnitten kan gå in på www.swefilmer.com och kolla där! Annars började säsong 4 på tv idag, men det var första avsnittet av säsong 4 som började på tv idag, annars finns det nog upp till 11 avsnitt på hemsidan.. så ja Jag har inte gjort så jävla mycket i helgen, eller ja dessa två dagarna. Egentligen har jag inte gjort någonting. Tänkte först att Becka skulle sova här igår men det blev inte av. Och till veckan måste jag iväg och fixa foto på mig själv som jag ska ha till mitt ID-kort, usch orkar inte. Hur som helst så har Justin's nya låt "Nothing like us" från Believe kommit ut, eller ja den finns iaf på youtube. Väntar nu bara på att den ska komma ut till Spotify också Och på tal om spotify så är det någon jobbig jävel som använder mitt account så min musik stoppas då & då.. duktigt jobbigt! Här har ni Justin's nya låt, otroligt fin och väldigt känslofylld. Nog den bästa han gjort enligt mig.
Justin Bieber - Nothing Like Us -
